nodes.bodyText: Is it possible that the CACHE_SERVICE_CREATE event is already triggered before we call the init method, and then we would just miss it entirely?
Should stopRedisServer be invoked in a similar way, i.e. by listening to the cache lifecycle events?
Does this actually test that the data structure was persistent? Maybe it would be better to do a restart, or assert on the underlying region type?
